availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Hamilton Gray, Jr. (Mason County, Kentucky, student)

body.p: Mason County, Kentucky student. Mason County, Kentucky native. Son of Hamilton Gray, Sr. and Elizabeth Johnston Gray. Attended school in Mason County, Kentucky in 1850. Household owned six enslaved persons in Mason County in 1850. Attended school in Mason County in 1860. Household employed Ellen Marion as a servant in Mason County 1860. Household owned two enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 49B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 691.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 346.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 3B.
